intro: Cryptantha cinerea var. jamesii, commonly known as the James' cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
